headline: Kentucky utilities shelve 1.6GWh BESS project, doubling down on fossil fuel expansion
summary_80w: Louisville Gas and Electric Company (LG&E) and Kentucky Utilities Company (KU) have withdrawn plans to deploy a new 400MW/1,600MWh BESS.

headline: Massachusetts issues RFP seeking 1,500MW of BESS
summary_80w: Massachusetts’s electric distribution companies (EDCs) and the state’s Department of Energy Resources (DOER) have launched a request for proposals (RFP) for approximately 1,500MW of mid-duration energy storage systems.

headline: Nextracker to supply 1.5GW Brazil hybrid solar portfolio with trackers
summary_80w: US solar tracker manufacturer Nextracker will supply 1.5GW of its products to a Brazilian solar PV hybrid project portfolio.

headline: Government of Brunei breaks ground on 30MW solar PV plant
summary_80w: The Government of Brunei Darussalam has broken ground on the 30MW solar PV power plant in Kampong Belimbing, the country’s largest solar facility to date.

headline: Highland Materials leases former nuclear site for Tennessee polysilicon plant
summary_80w: US polysilicon company Highland Materials has signed a long-term lease for the site of a planned “next-generation” polysilicon production facility in Tennessee.

headline: AFSIA: Solar is the ‘ideal’ power source as Africa exceeds 20GW of operational capacity
summary_80w: AFSIA CEO John van Zuylen told PV Tech Premium that solar power is the “ideal” technology type to improve electricity access in Africa.

headline: Uganda greenlights EA Astrovolt’s 100MW solar plus 250MWh BESS project
summary_80w: The Government of Uganda has authorised EA Astrovolt to develop a 100MWp solar PV power plant, integrated with a 250MWh storage system.

headline: Indonesia new programme targets 100GW solar PV, 320GWh BESS
summary_80w: The government of Indonesia has launched a programme that aims to build 100GW of solar PV in the coming years, mostly distributed across smaller projects in rural areas.

headline: PVH launches solar trackers with movement range of two degrees
summary_80w: PV Hardware's latest generation of trackers can move up to two degrees post-to-post, more than the current industry standard of 1.75 degrees.

headline: Australia’s New South Wales sets 16GW of renewables by 2030 target
summary_80w: Australia’s New South Wales has increased its renewable energy targets to 16GW of new clean power generation by 2030 and 42GWh of long-duration energy storage (LDES) by 2034.

headline: Fluence to hit lower end of 2025 guidance due to ‘typical’ ramping delays at US factories
summary_80w: Fluence expects to hit the lower end of its previously issued revenue guidance for the 2025 financial year due to delays in ramping up at US production sites.

headline: Chinese firms increase global BESS market share, except in North America: Tesla retains top spot
summary_80w: Wood Mackenzie's BESS supply rankings list shows 'intensifying regional competition and shifting dynamics' as Tesla remains number one.

headline: UK ROUNDUP: Project commissioning and deals for Wärtsilä, Canadian Solar, Gresham House and Eku Energy
summary_80w: Another edition of news in brief, focusing on the UK market with Wärtsilä, Canadian Solar, Gresham House and Eku Energy.

headline: OptiGrid: Lately, BESS in Australia’s NEM ‘rarely go fully contracted’
summary_80w: Sahand Karimi, CEO of OptiGrid, tells ESN Premium that the majority of BESS projects in the NEM “rarely go fully contracted”.

headline: Stor-Energy submits 730MWh BESS to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Stor-Energy has submitted plans for a 730MWh battery storage project in New South Wales to Australia's EPBC Act.

headline: Tesla, Sunrun hail ‘win-win for the household and the grid’ with California virtual power plant test
summary_80w: A 535MW fleet of aggregated household battery storage systems, including Tesla Powerwalls, effectively reduced net load on the California grid in a recent test event.

headline: Illuminate USA to acquire US-made solar glass from Solarcycle
summary_80w: Illuminate USA has signed a five-year deal with US panel recycling firm Solarcycle to acquire solar glass manufactured in the US.

headline: UVID is ‘particularly concerning’ for TOPCon cells – UNSW
summary_80w: Greater awareness of UV light used to test solar cells could result in faster, more efficient assessments of long-term performance.

headline: Winda Energy building 30MW/60MWh BESS in Finland with European suppliers
summary_80w: Developer Winda Energy will put a 30MW/60MWh BESS in Finland into operation next year, built with technology supplied by European companies.

headline: Risen Energy: Reliable, efficient energy storage from a trusted global name
summary_80w: One of the world’s major players in solar PV is also becoming a well-known name in the energy storage system (ESS) space.
